w:r.w:t: by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases:
he, she, tall, short, big, small, old, young, nice, mean, happy, sad, loud, quiet, He is _____, She is _______.
n of this lesson, students will be able to:
sets of words in complete sentences

Modeling the teacher, student performs the TPR actions for all adjectives on the slide
Teacher will review the adjective words, pronunciation and action to each word
Student will circle and say the adjective that the teacher acts out.
The teacher should act out different adjectives one at a time. The student should circle and say the adjective that the teacher is showing.

Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Students should have a blank slide to draw a picture of
he, she, tall, short, big, small, old, young, nice, mean, happy, sad, loud, quiet
he, she, tall, short, big, small, old, young, nice, mean, happy, sad, loud, quiet
Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent
he, she, tall, short, big, small, old, young, nice, mean, happy, sad, loud, quiet
through pictures. One prompt at a time.

he, she, tall, short, big, small, old, young, nice, mean, happy, sad, loud, quiet
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
he, she, tall, short, big, small, old, young, nice, mean, happy, sad, loud, quiet
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
